To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.
 



  





**About us** 




 Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2 000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing all across Europe, currently with more than 10 active international offices.
 



  





**What does it mean to be an IT Management Consultant at Netlight?** 




 It will vary a lot between Netlighters as we, around the right person, will design a role together with you. You will be starting somewhere familiar. For example as an IT Project Manager, Product Owner, Team Lead, Tech Lead, IT-Architect, IT-Infrastructure, Scrum Master, Product Manager or similar? And from there... It is your call how your career at Netlight will look, ranging from which clients you will work with, what role you want to take (based on your personal experience, strengths, your personal interest) and how your relationship with your mentor/coach/EDGE networks/social networks will look like.
 



  





 As a consultant at Netlight, you will build the products, systems and technical solutions of today and tomorrow. This means that our consultants get the opportunity to help build and scale existing and new products and companies and also continuously learn and master a variety of technical tools. At Netlight, we will challenge you. Our clients will challenge you. You will challenge our clients. You will challenge us. We will grow together and unleash the potential in each other.
 



  





 As an IT Management Consultant, you will most likely take projects in the area as Scrum Master, IT Project Manager, Product Owner, Product Manager, IT Architect, IT Infrastructure, Team Lead, Tech Lead, Technical Due Diligence, Agile coaching and other leadership roles in tech.
 



  





**Minimum Qualifications** 



* Master Degree in Engineering or Technology
* Verbal and written fluency in English and Swedish (or Danish/Norwegian)
* 0,5-5 years of work experience related to building software products together with software developers in agile teams
* Proven track-record from previous positions (e.g. recognized achievements & deliveries)



  





**Application** 




 We are always looking for new Netlighters, so feel free to apply if you meet the qualifications.
 



  





 We will try to get in touch within two weeks
 
 if
 
 we find that your profile and experiences are a match beyond the qualifications at this time - however, please note that during the summer, response times may take longer than usual.

title: Technical Support Representative
description:
**Why join us?**
 We’re on a mission to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. As the world-leader in assistive communication solutions, we empower our customers to express themselves, connect with the world, and live richer lives.
   

  

 At Tobii Dynavox, you can grow your career within a dynamic, global company that has a clear, impactful purpose - with the flexibility to also do what truly matters to you outside of work. What’s more, you’ll be part of a work culture where collaboration is the norm and individuality is welcomed.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you’ll have the power to make it happen. You’ll solve challenges, deliver solutions and develop new, efficient processes that make a direct impact on our customers’ lives.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 As a Technical Support Representative, you will join our multilingual Technical Support team, who are the product experts to whom users, professionals and partners turn to when in need of help.
   

  

 In this experience, you will be the voice of Tobii Dynavox to our users and partners in the United Kingdom and Ireland markets and deliver high-quality technical support, while gaining in-depth knowledge of our diverse portfolio of products. You can contribute significantly and thrive in this role with our support if you’re a fast learner who enjoys collaborating with colleagues across different teams.
   

  

 While your previous work experience is important, we also value finding a strong cultural fit. You don't need to be an IT expert, however, we greatly appreciate your interest in technology, technical background, if you have, and your familiarity with using both Windows and Apple products.
   

  

**Please note:** 
 This is a full-time, permanent and
 **onsite** 
 role at our office in
 **Stockholm city** 
 . Our working hours are 9am-6 pm from Monday to Friday.
   

  

  

  

**In this role, you will:**
**Technical Support & Issue Resolution:**
* Assist customers, partners, and internal colleagues with any technical inquiries and supporting requests about our products. Build understanding of product features, functionalities and best practices, empowering them to resolve issues independently.
* Troubleshoot issues across our hardware and software platforms via phone, email, chat and remote desktop sessions, collaborating with developers and other stakeholders when necessary.
* Nurture and maintain strong customer relationships by demonstrating empathy, patience, and commitment to their success, whatever that looks like for them.
* Collaborate with our marketing team to monitor our social media channels.


  

  

**Documentation & Knowledge Sharing:**
* Assist in the development and maintenance of technical documentation such as articles, FAQs, and user guides tailored for target regions.


  

  

**What We're Looking For:**
* Educational background in relevant fields such as Speech-Language Pathology and Linguistics is preferred.
* Previous experience in customer-facing role such as customer service, technical or product support. Familiarity with Windows and/or iOS environment is a great asset.
* Experience with CRM and ERP systems (such as Salesforce or Dynamics) is a great asset.
* Empathic approach and skills in problem solving and active listening to resolve technical issues while maintaining high customer satisfaction are required.
* Communication and collaboration skills to interact with tech-savvy people while making computer novices feel supported and understood.
* Proficiency in written and spoken English is required. Proficiency in German or French is a bonus.


  

  

**Apply today!**
 We believe in empowering individuals - including our own employees - to reach their full potential. So, if you want to change lives while growing your own career, we’d love to hear from you.

title: HR Advisor
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Saab is a place where teamwork makes things fly. Literally. Join us and experience our supportive and friendly workplace.*
 Your role
   

  

 We are seeking an HR Advisor to join our dynamic team and provide essential support to the organization in HR-related matters. This generalist HR role is crucial to our success, offering advisory and support services to both employees and managers, while ensuring the efficient and accurate handling of HR processes and cases.
   

  

 People Support add value to the business through the enablement and execution of people processes through knowledge, education and support.
   

  

 Your key responsibilities will be:
   

  

* Staffing the support and managing HR Cases


 Manage phone and chat support, handling incoming HR cases professionally and efficiently, and providing accurate HR information via internal systems.
   

  

* In-depth responsibilities


 Take independent ownership of tasks defined by the current responsibility matrix, ensuring all HR processes are followed and implemented correctly and effectively.
   

  

* Keeping HR information and knowledge up to date


 Ensure that HR-related information and knowledge are kept current and available to both the team and other parts of the organisation.
   

  

* Contributing to team development and improvements


 Actively participate in team development, optimising workflows, strengthening team cohesion, and improving working methods.
   

  

 Your profile
   

  

 This is a versatile role with focus on continuous development. As a part of the People Support team, you will work in a fast-paced and ever-evolving environment, with the opportunity to contribute to and shape HR operations in line with the company’s needs. To apply for this role, we expect you to meet the following requirements and expectations:
   

  

* Strong interest or proven experience in an HR generalist role or similar HR positions
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks effectively
* A proactive approach to problem-solving and process improvement
* Passion for continuous learning and development
* Experience in HR systems and tools (e.g., Workday) is a plus


- 

 You also have excellent communication skills in Swedish and in English, both verbal and written.
   

  

 We offer a collaborative and supportive working environment with opportunities for growth and professional development. If you’re ready to make a positive impact and help drive HR excellence within our organization, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now and take the next step in your HR career!
   

  

*This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.*
 What you will be a part of
   

  

 Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
   

  

 Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 25,500 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

*Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement.*

title: Operations Manager
description:
Looking to be part of an exciting growth journey and be part of a team that is reshaping short-term stay experiences? Guestit is seeking our next Operations Manager to lead and evolve our day-to-day housekeeping operations in Stockholm. In this role, you will be responsible to lead the Housekeeping team, covering both housekeeping and supply logistics. The team plays a critical role in creating memorable experiences and ensuring 5-star stays for our guests. 
 




  





**About Guestit** 





 Guestit is the leading short-term property rental company in the Nordics, with operations in Stockholm, Gothenburg, and Åre. We have a clear ambition to expand into other Nordic geographies and are rapidly growing (50%+ YoY growth). In Stockholm, we operate 400+ properties and are rapidly expanding.
 




  





**What to expect in the role** 





 You will ensure we continuously improve operational efficiency and quality leveraging a data-driven approach, strong leadership skills and a can-do attitude. The role will include responsibility for leading day-to-day operations of the internal and external cleaning teams, and the logistics team in combination with taking a more strategic approach in identifying and driving improvement initiatives, with support from the broader operations and overall management team. In the role you will be reporting to the COO and be part of the Operations Leadership Team. The schedule in this role may require work during weekends, as the nature of our business is skewed towards weekend stays.
 




  






 Responsibilities include:
 



* Lead and manage the team, from recruitment, onboarding, scheduling, development and performance coaching with direct team (cleaners and logistics staff).
* Manage logistics and purchasing of bed linen, cleaning supplies, guest amenities, and more.
* Identify, monitor and improve Housekeeping OKRs & KPIs (e.g. cleanliness score, % cleaning defects, cleaning turnaround time, profitability).
* Establish, maintain and improve documented routines, ensuring clear, efficient and high quality instructions. This will be key to enable future expansion.
* Through the team establish processes and routines that ensure that we review, document, and support addressing issues in the apartments that ensures high quality stays for our guests.
* Directly handle guest conversations, complaints and escalations when needed.



  





**What you will bring to the team** 





 The role includes taking responsibility for a large, labour intensive part of our business, which is why we are looking for a person who is a strong leader and who has experience in planning and structuring work in a similar capacity. To be successful, you’ll need a strong drive, have an eye for detail, be analytical and have good communication skills. You are also used to, and enjoy, working with people, both when being part of and managing a team. We believe having a background in professional housekeeping operations or facility management with logistics experience will make you successful in this role. Having practical experience of professional housekeeping yourself is a strong plus.
 




  






 Qualifications
 



* 3+ years experience from a related industry (e.g. hospitality management, facility management, housekeeping management).
* Proven leadership skills from a labour intensive industry with decentralized teams.
* Strong results connected to driving efficiency (e.g. shift planning) and quality (e.g. onboarding and training of employees).
* High drive and work morale, with focus on getting things done and driving continuous improvement.
* Experience working with guest/customer experiences with high attention to satisfaction and quality.
* Good understanding of how to use IT-systems in your daily work (e.g. scheduling programs).
* Strong communication skills. English & Swedish required. Other languages are a plus as our team comes from a diverse set of other nationalities.
* Drivers license type B.



  





**What we offer:** 



* Full time - 6 months probationary employment, followed by permanent employment
* Fixed salary
* Placement in the Stockholm region.
* Employment start date as soon as possible.
* Fast-paced environment and growing business, with many opportunities to grow and develop with the company.



  





**Interested?** 





 Apply to the job and we will reach out to you regarding the application.
 





 Apply today; we will be reviewing applicants on an ongoing basis.
 





 Guestit Official Website: www.guestit.se

title: Bli IT Support Specialist hos ABG Sundal Collier!
description:
**ABG Sundal Collier söker en nyfiken och serviceinriktad IT Support Specialist till centrala kontoret i Stockholm!**
 Vill du utvecklas i en IT-miljö där ingen dag är den andra lik? Hos ABG Sundal Collier i Stockholm får du möjlighet att arbeta brett inom IT-support, projekt och infrastruktur. Här får du en central roll där du arbetar i ett tight och kunnigt team med mycket engagemang och frihet under ansvar.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* En varierad vardag och lärorik miljö där du får arbeta nära användare och teknik.
* Möjlighet att bidra i både support och projekt, med chans till utveckling inom flera områden.
* Stor frihet att arbeta självständigt och ta ansvar, samtidigt som du får kontinuerligt stöd från dina kollegor.
* Centralt beläget kontor i Stockholm med gemensamma aktiviteter och moderna verktyg.


**Det här gör du hos oss**
**Som IT Support Specialist Kommer Du Att**
* Hantera dagliga IT-supportärenden inom hårdvara, mjukvara, nätverk, telefoni och konferensrum.
* Hantera onboarding för nya medarbetare vad gäller teknisk utrustning som dator, telefon, licenser, passerkort m.m.
* Delta i projekt och tekniska uppdateringar.
* Sköta beställningar och kontakt med leverantörer.
* Samarbeta med kollegor för att proaktivt lösa tekniska utmaningar och förbättra interna processer.


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 I rollen som IT Support Specialist utgår du från Stockholmskontoret och blir en del av det lokala IT-teamet på tre personer. Teamet samarbetar nära IT-avdelningen i Oslo och har daglig kontakt med användare i hela organisationen. Rollen kräver närvaro på kontoret under kontorstid.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 Vi söker dig med erfarenhet av IT-support som trivs med att arbeta brett med system och vardaglig användarsupport. För att lyckas i rollen behöver du goda kunskaper inom IT-infrastruktur, hårdvara, mjukvara samt molntjänster, t.ex. Microsoft 365, Azure, SharePoint, Teams och Intune.
   

  

 Som person är du serviceinriktad, självgående och har lätt för att anpassa dig till olika situationer. Du har ett strukturerat arbetssätt, god kommunikationsförmåga och tycker om att hjälpa andra, oavsett om det handlar om att lösa akuta problem eller planera tekniska förbättringar.
   

  

 Du talar och skriver obehindrat på både svenska och engelska.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Observera att urvalsprocessen kan ta längre tid än vanligt på grund av sommarledigheter.
   

  

**Så här får vi kontakt**
 I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Smart Hands Datacenter Engineer
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Have you gained IT hardware related experience through your studies, work or general technical interest and would like to start or continue to work with physical IT hardware on enterprise level datacenter environments at Telia? My name is Markus Kaseva and I am in a quest to find our new HW enthusiast to work in Storage and Datacenter team in Stockholm, Sweden to operate and built physical IT infrastructure as smart hands engineer. Join us on this “hands on” opportunity to grow with us, learn new skills and build enterprise IT infra.
   

  

**As a Smart Hands Engineer...**
 You will gain unique insight into the datacenter operations of a large international telecom operator. You will be part of a highly motivated team responsible for operations and installations of network equipment, servers, storage devices, all things connected to previous and AI platforms. In this role, you will primarily work on HW installations and cabling to incident management, analyzing, reporting, and resolving incidents while continuously learning and growing in a rapidly evolving technology landscape.
   

  

 Tasks also include managing and guiding vendor and 3rd party field engineers working with us in Sweden and in other Nordic countries. Not forgetting the documentation.
   

  

 You will actively collaborate across different stakeholders in Telia to overcome challenges, contribute to operations, incident and change management automation initiatives, and support the team in delivering exceptional service. This position requires you to work in secure Datacenter facilities as part of 24/7 on-call group.
   

  

**Who We're Looking For…**
 We’re looking for someone who brings curiosity, problem solving mindset, resilience, willingness to learn and a service-oriented mindset. A technical degree or certification in Telecom, IT, or Networks is valuable, but more important is your ambition to learn, adapt, and support a team that values collaboration and precision. You must also be able to work outside of regular office hours, including nights and weekends, as part of a rotating on-call schedule and hand on work at datacenters. Driving license is required as commuting between datacenters is part of the job.
   

  

 You have a technical background in Telecom, IT, or networks, and a good understanding of IT hardware. You are fluent in English and Swedish, both spoken and written. You bring hands-on experience or strong interest in building physical infrastructure, incident management, and ideally, routing and switching technologies. Prior experience in technical customer support is considered a plus. The position will be adjusted on the skill levels you bring as junior or senior engineer.
   

  

**We are more than a workplace**
 Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.
   

  

**Ready to make better happen?**
 We´re looking forward to your application by 18/07/2025. Please apply through our recruitment system to keep your data safe, as we can’t accept resumes via email. Required background checks will be performed.
   

  

**Join us and let’s make better happen – together!**

title: Lösningsarkitekt
description:
**Lösningsarkitekt inom IT – Strategisk roll i samhällsviktig organisation | Stockholm** 




  





 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens digitala lösningar i en organisation som skapar verklig samhällsnytta – både i Sverige och internationellt? Då kan detta vara rätt möjlighet för dig. Vi söker nu (på uppdrag av kund) en
 **Senior** 
**Lösningsarkitekt** 
 som vill bidra till att stärka Sveriges position inom ett område med stor påverkan på samhälle och näringsliv.
 



  





**Ditt uppdrag som Lösningsarkitekt** 




 I denna roll får du en nyckelposition i organisationens pågående förändringsresa, där IT spelar en avgörande roll för att möjliggöra innovation och effektivitet. Du ansvarar för att säkerställa att IT-arkitekturen är modern, säker och långsiktigt hållbar. Arbetet sker både på konceptuell och logisk nivå, med fokus på att tekniska lösningar ska stödja verksamhetens mål.
 



  





**Du kommer att:** 



* Utveckla lösningar som är skalbara och hållbara över tid
* Påverka framtida systemval och arkitekturprinciper
* Leda arkitekturråd där utveckling, infrastruktur och verksamhet samverkar
* Säkerställa att nya system och verktyg fungerar i samklang med befintliga ramverk och modeller



  





 IT-avdelningen består av cirka 25 medarbetare och konsulter, varav majoriteten arbetar med egenutvecklade lösningar. Du rapporterar till IT-chefen och samarbetar nära både tekniska och verksamhetsnära funktioner.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som har:** 



* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom systemvetenskap, datateknik eller motsvarande – alternativt likvärdig erfarenhet
* Gedigen erfarenhet av applikationsutveckling med objektorienterade språk och arkitektur, alternativt en bakgrund inom Projektledning eller liknande
* Förmåga att omsätta verksamhetsbehov till tekniska lösningar
* God kännedom om Microsoftbaserad infrastruktur och molntjänster som Azure
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt och vedertagna modeller för styrning
* Förmåga att se helheten och förstå hur tekniska förändringar påverkar organisationen



  





**Att arbeta hos oss** 




 Här blir du en del av en kunskapsintensiv verksamhet där experter från olika områden samverkar för att ta fram lösningar med stor påverkan på både samhälle och näringsliv. Organisationen har en lång historia av att bidra till hållbar utveckling och innovation, och har på senare år fått ökad uppmärksamhet för sitt arbete inom områden som cirkulär ekonomi, biologisk mångfald och teknisk standardisering.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder en arbetsmiljö som präglas av omtanke, tillit och professionalism. Du arbetar i moderna lokaler i centrala Stockholm och erbjuds attraktiva anställningsförmåner samt möjlighet till hybridarbete.

title: Electrical Engineering Manager
company_industry: Electric Power Transmission, Control, and Distribution and Construction
description:
Electrical Construction Manager – Lead Data Centre Projects in Sweden
 



 Sweden (On-site) | Competitive Salary + Benefits
 



 Are you a seasoned Electrical Construction Manager ready to lead mission-critical data centre projects in Europe? Our client, a global leader in critical infrastructure delivery, is hiring a dynamic professional to drive electrical installations for cutting-edge data centres in Sweden. Join a team shaping the future of digital infrastructure!
 



 What You’ll Do
 


* Lead the planning and execution of electrical systems for large-scale data centre construction, ensuring projects meet timelines, budgets, and quality standards.
* Manage and motivate electrical subcontractor teams, fostering collaboration and compliance with health and safety regulations.
* Coordinate technical drawings, specifications, and commissioning processes, resolving challenges with precision.
* Drive quality assurance, overseeing test packs, handover documentation, and system integration.
* Champion safety and compliance, conducting site inspections and implementing process improvements.
* Collaborate with clients, project managers, and multidisciplinary teams to deliver world-class data centres.



 What We’re Looking For
 


* Education: Bachelor’s/Master’s in Electrical Engineering or related field (HNC/HND highly desirable).
* Experience: 7+ years in construction management, with 3+ years leading electrical installations. Data centre or mission-critical infrastructure experience is a big plus!
* Skills: Expertise in electrical systems (high/low voltage, power distribution), proficiency in project management tools, and familiarity with BIM (a bonus).
* Leadership: Proven ability to manage subcontractor teams and deliver under pressure.
* Communication: Strong interpersonal skills; fluency in English (Swedish proficiency a plus).
* Safety: Deep knowledge of construction safety standards and a proactive approach to risk management.



 Why This Role?
 


* Work on high-impact data centre projects driving global connectivity.
* Grow your career with a leader in critical infrastructure and a collaborative, innovative team.
* Enjoy a competitive salary, benefits, and opportunities to shine in the data centre industry.



 Ready to Power the Future?
 



 Apply now by sending your CV to [insert agency contact details or LinkedIn application link]. Tag a colleague who’d excel in this role or share this post to your network! Let’s connect and discuss how you can lead mission-critical projects in Sweden.
 



 #ElectricalConstruction #DataCentre #ConstructionManagement #ElectricalEngineering #MissionCritical #DataCentreJobs #SwedenJobs #ProjectManagement #CriticalInfrastructure #ElectricalInstallations

title: Group Manager Industrial IT - Manufacturing
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 We are looking for an experienced group manager to lead Shopfloor IT systems through the ongoing Nova program. The Nova Program is supporting Scania’s and Traton’s transformation of the Production & Logistics (P&L) Process and IT landscape. Now our current manager for the Manufacturing team is leaving for a new challenge. So, if you love Manufacturing and like a challenge, this is the perfect time to join this exciting journey.
   

  

 Today’s team exists of 8 business architects. As a member of the Industrial IT leadership team you are actively developing our department in line with our strategy.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 Our successful candidate is an experienced leader that can support the team in looking ahead. You help the team to secure that capability roadmap and portfolio’s fulfill Scania’s and Traton’s upcoming needs. As a servant leader you enable the team to succeed with their deliveries. You communicate expectations and know that feedback is crucial in driving the development of both team and individual.
   

  

 Having a close dialogue with stake holders cross functional Scania is natural to you, as to support your team’s deliverables. You are strong in communication, creating structure around you, making clear analysis and conclusions. You have broad knowledge of the manufacturing and affinity with IT. You probably have an engineering education and/or equivalent experience. You are probably well in your Scania career and have experience from manufacturing. You need to be proficient in written and spoken English. We expect basic skills in Swedish.
   

  

**This is us**
 Global Industrial Development is a unit within Production & Logistics at Scania. The unit supports the operational sectors of Chassis & Cabs, Powertrain as well as Logistics. One of the responsibilities within the unit is Industrial IT (department VEI). Industrial IT’s mission is to support Scania’s P&L towards a digitally powered Industrial System to deliver world class products. For todays and future needs, based on a unified way of working, we create and maintain a well designed and known business architecture. This architecture, together with P&L strategic priorities is the basis for the transformation roadmaps, towards the New Order to deliVery Architecture, NOVA.
   

  

 Our future IT Landscape consist of 3 main cornerstones within PDM/PLM, ERP, MES and PRINS as a bridge in the middle. All efforts are part of the NOVA (New Order to delivery Architecture) Program, implementing the new business processes and IT Solutions at Scania. The program receives high attention and expectations from Scania's top management.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We offer a workplace with a lot of cross functional contacts. At VEI we care deeply about diversity and inclusion – if you feel you do not match all requirements, please demonstrate how your passion, attitude and interest in the success of Scania compensates for that!
   

  

 In this position you get good insight in were Scania P&L as a whole. As we are keen on our transformation journey we welcome you who want to drive this change forward.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-08-10.
 **Since Scania will be closed for the summer during weeks 29–32, the initial selection and interviews will begin in week 33** 
 . Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process and a background check is required for this role.
   

  

 If you think this is an interesting challenge and need more information, please contact Thijs Zwaveling Head of VEI Industrial IT within Global industrial Development, thijs.zwaveling@scania.com or Andreas Holmgren andreas.holmgren@scania.com.
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Senior managementkonsult inom IT-sourcing för offentlig sektor
description:
**Vill du vara med och stärka den strategiska förmågan inom IT-sourcing i offentlig sektor – och bidra till ett smartare och mer hållbart samhälle?**
 Vi söker dig som vill hjälpa våra kunder att identifiera rätt leverantörer, utforma hållbara upphandlingsstrategier och skapa långsiktiga samarbeten som stödjer verksamhetens mål. Här får du möjlighet att göra verklig skillnad i hur offentlig sektor tar tillvara på kraften i digitalisering och ny teknik – alltid med verksamhetsnytta och affärsvärde i fokus.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Vi letar efter en senior managementkonsult med ett starkt engagemang för att skapa värde hos kund och som motiveras av att stötta organisationer att navigera i en komplex vardag präglad av digital transformation, ökade krav på effektivitet och möjligheter inom bland annat ny teknik, såsom AI.
   

  

 I våra uppdrag arbetar vi nära kundens verksamhet, ofta i team, där du kan få ta rollen som rådgivare, projektledare eller förändringsledare – från tidig förstudie till implementering. Rollen är dynamisk och kräver både praktiskt genomförandefokus och ett helhetsperspektiv – du behöver kunna växla mellan att arbeta operativt nära kunden och samtidigt se till att det långsiktiga strategiska målet hålls i sikte.
   

  

 Exempel på uppgifter:
   

  

* Utforma sourcingstrategier och genomföra komplexa IT-upphandlingar, ofta inom ramen för LOU
* Fånga och omsätta behov till krav och utvärderingsmodeller
* Stötta införandet av nya lösningar, processer och arbetssätt
* Stärka kundens förmåga att följa upp avtal och utveckla goda leverantörsrelationer
* Bidra i analyser och roadmap-arbete kopplat till digitalisering och verksamhetsutveckling
* Identifiera möjligheter att skapa affärsvärde och långsiktiga relationer – både för kunden och för Knowit


 Vi verkar främst inom offentlig sektor, men många av oss arbetar också mot privata aktörer. Vi tror att den bästa utvecklingen sker när olika perspektiv möts, och ser gärna att du är nyfiken på båda världar.
   

  

**Vem vi tror att du är**
 Du är en erfaren konsult - eller har en liknande roll i offentlig sektor - och är van att arbeta strukturerat och lösningsorienterat i komplexa uppdrag. Du trivs med att både tänka strategiskt och få saker att hända operativt. Du värdesätter laganda, är prestigelös och får energi av att arbeta tillsammans med andra.
   

  

 Kanske arbetar du idag som upphandlare, inköpare eller jurist, och vill ta steget till en mer rådgivande roll där du får använda din förståelse för regelverk, verksamhet och digitalisering för att skapa verklig förändring.
   

  

 För att trivas och lyckas i rollen söker vi dig som:
   

  

* Har omkring 5 års erfarenhet som managementkonsult eller motsvarande bakgrund inom offentlig sektor
* Har ett starkt intresse för IT och digitalisering – med nyfikenhet för möjligheter och utmaningar inom såväl ny teknik, säkerhet och juridik
* Har arbetat med strategiska upphandlingar enligt LOU
* Projektledning i komplexa miljöer
* Är noggrann, affärsdriven och trivs med att ta ansvar
* Är proaktiv i att identifiera nya behov och utvecklingsmöjligheter hos kunden
* Är van att kommunicera med olika intressenter, både i tal och skrift
* Är bekväm i en ledande roll men också lyhörd i samarbetet med andra


**Meriterande är erfarenhet från exempelvis:**
* Uppdrag kopplade till ny teknik, såsom AI, som skapar verksamhetsnytta
* Har god förmåga att bygga relationer på CxO-nivå och att identifiera affärsmöjligheter i strategiska dialoger.


**Varför ska du välja oss**
 Hos oss får du:
   

  

* Arbeta i ett värderingsstyrt bolag med omtanke, mod och samarbete som ledord
* Tillhöra ett drivet och prestigelöst team med hög kompetens och stor nyfikenhet
* Möjlighet att påverka både affär, kultur och din egen utveckling
* Delta i spännande uppdrag som bidrar till ett smartare och mer hållbart samhälle
* Följa med på vår tillväxtresa där vi tillsammans skapar framtidens Knowit


**Låter det intressant?**
 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 Vi publicerar den här annonsen inför sommaren och kommer att starta urvalet i augusti. Du är varmt välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan nu, och vi återkopplar så snart processen drar igång efter semestern.
   

  

 Vi använder oss av kompetensbaserad rekrytering och inkluderar tester för logisk-analytisk förmåga och personlighet i processen.
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten? Hör gärna av dig till Frida Thure, Head of IT-Sourcing på 070-287 48 78, frida.thure@knowit.se eller Emma Lemon, Head of People & Talent, på emma.lemon@knowit.se.
   

  

 Tills dess – ha en riktigt fin sommar!
   

  

**Om Knowit Insight Accelerate**
*Knowit Insight Accelerate är ett dotterbolag inom Knowit koncernen med ca 80 managementkonsulter verksamma i Stockholm och andra större städer i Sverige. Vi stöttar kunder inom både privat och offentlig sektor med strategiutveckling och digital transformation inom bland annat Ekonomi, HR, IT, Hållbarhet och Ledarskap.*
**Om Knowit**
*Knowit etablerades 1990 och har idag drygt 4.300 medarbetare representerade på ett flertal orter i Norden. Verksamheten finns i Sverige, Norge, Danmark, Finland, Tyskland och Polen. Knowit är börsnoterat på Nasdaq i Stockholm. Inom Knowit Insight, Knowits managementkonsultverksamhet, är vi uppemot 550 konsulter. Vi är digitaliseringskonsulter och ett nordiskt powerhouse för framtidens digitala affärsmodeller. Vår vision är att skapa ett hållbart och mänskligt samhälle genom digitalisering och innovation - vi är* 
*makers of a sustainable future.*

title: Customer Experience Agent
description:
**Juni who? 👋**
 At Juni, we’re busy building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.
   

  

**How & Why We Do It 🚀**
 We give our people the same thing we’re building for our customers: freedom. Freedom to be 100% yourself. Freedom to explore your potential and what’s more – make the most of it. We truly believe we’re making the world a better place for online businesses, and we want you to be a part of that mission.
   

  

**Your role at a glance 🤸‍♀️**
 As a Customer Experience Agent at Juni, you will be part of our CX team dedicated to delivering exceptional experiences to our customers. You’ll be the first point of contact for inbound inquiries, resolving issues with empathy, clarity, and speed. Delivering valuable customer feedback internally to our wider org, and working closely within the CS function. You’ll help shape how our customers perceive Juni every day. Your work will directly contribute to building trust and driving customer loyalty as we scale.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities 👏**
 In this role, you’ll:
   

  

**Resolve Customer Inquiries**
* Manage all inbound support conversations via Intercom chat and support email.
* Triage and escalate urgent or high-risk issues, such as fraud or critical payment failures.


**Maintain Communication Standards**
* Deliver clear, consistent, and empathetic support in every interaction.
* Ensure all conversations are tagged with the correct types, subtypes, prior to closure.


**Drive Continuous Improvement**
* Surface recurring issues and feedback to Product/Engineering, Commercial, Leadership.
* Contribute to monthly reporting on CSAT trends, issue volumes, and SLA performance.


**Uphold SLAs and KPIs**
* First Response Time: Chat/Email varies depending on SLA (URGENT,HIGH,NORMAL,LOW)
* Resolution Time: Chat/Email varies depending on SLA (URGENT,HIGH,NORMAL,LOW)
* CSAT: >90% positive rating


**Weekend Coverage**
* Provide URGENT priority coverage during weekends and red days


**Tooling ⚙️**
* Intercom
* G-suite
* Slack
* Hubspot
* Notion


**Qualifications 👑**
***What we need to see***
* 1–3 years of experience in a customer support or CX role, ideally in fintech, SaaS, or fast-growing digital products.
* Proven track record of meeting SLAs and high CSAT scores.
* Excellent written and verbal Swedish and English communication.
* Comfort handling sensitive or high-risk scenarios (e.g., fraud, payment issues).


**What We’d Love To See**
* Experience working with Intercom.
* Familiarity with basic accounting or financial services concepts.
* Experience contributing to support process improvements or knowledge base content.


**Your people 👥**
 Our team is as ambitious as our amazing customers. We aim high and we move with speed to make our vision a reality. We care deeply about building a better future for our customers and each other. Here, you can work with people at the top of their game and who didn’t get there by playing games. You can help us create a whole new category in financial services.
   

  

**Your Benefits 😍**
 We’re freedom-first. Transparent. Caring. Empowering. So our benefits are too.
   

  

* We work hybrid. We'll see you in one of our offices in Stockholm or Gothenburg at least two days per week.
* Swap 2D for 3D. Meet all Junis IRL at the company onsite each year.
* Diversity is at our core. We're part Swedish. Part Canadian. Part French. Part Indian. Part Italian. Part British. Part Portuguese. You get the idea.
* Great players can stay great players. Progress your career whether you choose to manage people or not.
* Stock options. We can’t promise you’ll make a fortune. But we’ll give it our very best shot.
* Vacation days. 30 days. Awesome.
* Private Health insurance. You know. Just in case
* Beautiful offices in central Gothenburg and Stockholm, front row sea view!


 At Juni, we’re building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.

title: Solutions Engineer II (presales) - Cloud and Cybersecurity
description:
**Job Description**
**Are you passionate about Internet technologies and cloud computing?**
**Do you love helping customers overcome challenges?**
**Join our Solutions Engineering team**
 The PreSales engineering team is the technical partner to Sales. We provide unanticipated value and strive to provide the right solutions to our customers. Our team possesses the deepest levels of technical understanding and builds relationships to understand customer business drivers. We match these to Akamai's technology, and clearly articulating complex solutions to our customers.
   

  

**Shape the future of the Internet**
 We work with world leading companies in every major industry to make the internet fast and secure. As Solutions Engineer, you'll build relationships, becoming a trusted advisor to our customers, delivering innovative solutions. You will get to work with all the technologies Akamai has to offer. You will become an expert in Cloud and Cybersecurity.
   

  

**As a Solutions Engineer, You Will Be Responsible For**
* Growing revenue and acquire new business by evangelizing Akamai's technology to existing and prospective customers.
* Managing the technical proposal process and ensuring all technical information and recommendations addressing customer requirements are accurate.
* Engaging with customers during the sales-cycle to gather requirements and develop proposals, design, delivery, demo's and proof-of-concepts.
* Collaborating with internal Stakeholders to strengthen customer relationships by becoming the go-to person for technical queries.


**Do What You Love**
 To be successful in this role you will:
   

  

* Have experience in a technical pre-sales/sales engineering, consulting, or customer facing role delivering technical products or services.
* Demonstrate knowledge in Cloud and Internet technologies, including security solutions, compute, content delivery and web architecture (DNS,HTTP,TCP/IP,TLS).
* Have interpersonal savvy, a passion to solve problems, and a customer focused mindset.
* Have a thirst for learning and embracing new technologies.
* Be a good team player, able to collaborate, prioritize, and solve problems in a fast changing environment.
* Be fluent in both Swedish and English


**Work in a way that works for you**
 FlexBase, Akamai's Global Flexible Working Program, is based on the principles that are helping us create the best workplace in the world. When our colleagues said that flexible working was important to them, we listened. We also know flexible working is important to many of the incredible people considering joining Akamai. FlexBase, gives 95% of employees the choice to work from their home, their office, or both (in the country advertised). This permanent workplace flexibility program is consistent and fair globally, to help us find incredible talent, virtually anywhere. We are happy to discuss working options for this role and encourage you to speak with your recruiter in more detail when you apply.
   

  

 Learn what makes Akamai a great place to work
   

  

 Connect with us on social and see what life at Akamai is like!
   

  

**We power and protect life online, by solving the toughest challenges, together.**
 At Akamai, we're curious, innovative, collaborative and tenacious. We celebrate diversity of thought and we hold an unwavering belief that we can make a meaningful difference. Our teams use their global perspectives to put customers at the forefront of everything they do, so if you are people-centric, you'll thrive here.
   

  

**Working for you**
**Benefits**
 At Akamai, we will provide you with opportunities to grow, flourish, and achieve great things. Our benefit options are designed to meet your individual needs for today and in the future. We provide benefits surrounding all aspects of your life:
   

  

* Your health
* Your finances
* Your family
* Your time at work
* Your time pursuing other endeavors


 Our benefit plan options are designed to meet your individual needs and budget, both today and in the future.
   

  

**About Us**
 Akamai powers and protects life online. Leading companies worldwide choose Akamai to build, deliver, and secure their digital experiences helping billions of people live, work, and play every day. With the world's most distributed compute platform from cloud to edge we make it easy for customers to develop and run applications, while we keep experiences closer to users and threats farther away.
   

  

**Join us**
 Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting services and clients? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you!

title: Installationstekniker i Stockholm
description:
Är du redo för en spännande utmaning? ASSA ABLOY Entrance Systems AB söker en engagerad Installationstekniker inom Affärsområde - Business Segment Pedestrian.
   

  

 Gör din professionella resa meningsfull och bidra till att omdefiniera branschen med oss. Kan du bidra med en innovativ syn på ASSA ABLOY Entrance Systems? Bli en del av vårt team i Stockholm, och upplev en samarbetskultur som ger dig möjlighet att bygga en karriär som du kan vara stolt över.
   

  

**Vad du kommer att göra som vår Installationstekniker**
 I rollen som Installationstekniker arbetar du med installationer av slagdörrar, skjutdörrar och karuselldörrar. Du blir vårt ansikte utåt och i ditt arbetssätt visar du på ett starkt initiativ för att sätta dig in i och installera våra produkter i fält. Din kännedom om företagets produkter gör att du kan utföra felfria installationer till den höga kvalitet som våra kunder är vana vid. Du tar fullt ansvar för din arbetstid och genom att förstå helheten kan du ge den allra bästa kundupplevelsen. Ingen dag är den andra lik så därför krävs en god förmåga att vara flexibel och att kunna omprioritera. Resor i tjänsten förekommer och övernattningar förekommer emellanåt. Resor utanför sin egen distrikt kan förekomma.
   

  

 Tjänsten är särskilt meriterande för dig som bor i Stockholm med omnejd.
   

  

 Tjänsten kan komma att inledas med 6 månaders visstidsanställning.
   

  

**Färdigheterna och erfarenheten du behöver**
 För att vara framgångsrik i denna roll behöver du:
   

  

* Teknisk förståelse inom mekanik, elektronik och hydralik är meriterande, inget krav samt ett stort intresse för teknik.
* 3-årig gymnasieutbildning inom el, mekanik, bygg eller likvärdigt.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och grundläggande engelska.
* Erfarenhet av MS Office, samt 2-4 års erfarenhet som servicetekniker eller likvärdigt.
* Innehav av B-körkort.


 Som person har du en stark serviceinriktning och en förmåga att bygga relationer, vilket kombineras med tydlig kommunikation, självständighet, flexibilitet, struktur och ansvarstagande.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Vi brinner för att erbjuda fantastiska möjligheter och förmåner, så att du kan fortsätta och utveckla en livslång karriär hos oss – här är vad vi har att erbjuda:
   

  

* Möjligheter till lärande och karriärutveckling, vare sig det är online-utbildning, ledarträning eller stärkande av dina färdigheter.
* En konkurrenskraftig lön och bonus
* Friskvård
* Jobba med härliga kollegor
* Kollektivavtal


**Vi granskar ansökningar regelbundet, så vänta inte**
 Vi bygger mångsidiga och inkluderande team och uppmanar ansökningar från alla som kan se sig själva arbeta med oss.
   

  

 För att säkerställa att din personliga information är säker, tittar vi inte på några ansökningar som skickas via e-post eller post. Om du har några frågor om rollen eller processen, skicka ett e-postmeddelande till Mona Yusefi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, på mona.yusefi@assaabloy.com.
   

  

 Låt oss tillsammans skapa en tryggare och mer öppen värld!
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Head of Key Account Management
company_industry: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
foodora is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience—fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide. Headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Do you have the ability to, on a strategic level, develop and lead a Key Account Management Department to success? As our new Head of KAM you will not only spend your days leading amazing colleagues, you will also strategically set growth plans, business reviews and overall develop the business with our strategic accounts. You will build long-lasting relationships and work closely with the management and key stakeholders in the establishment of departmental strategies, goals, and targets. If you have a few years of experience from similar roles and want to join our fast paced journey - we’re gonna welcome you to our pink family with open arms!
   

  

**Your mission**
* Take overall responsibility for our Key Account Management team at foodora, which includes the personnel responsibility for 4-6 Key Account Managers
* Take strategic ownership of the department. This includes developing and implementing new processes and structures for our strategic accounts. For example, implement monthly/quarterly Business reviews
* Implement commercial strategies. For example, how to increase growth and maximize value for our strategic accounts. Make sure our strategic accounts are fully integrated with our Ecosystem (deals, ad tech, subscription, POS etc).
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders, both on an operational and strategic level
* Participate in key meetings with strategic accounts
* Lead complex commercial projects. For example commission increase initiatives
* Utilize and implement best practices from other Delivery Hero markets in order to drive development in the strategic Account Management area.


 Our selection process is continuous and the ad may close before the recruitment process is completed, if we’ve moved forward to the screening or interview phase.
   

  

**Our recruitment process will include the following:**
 📞 Telephone interview - Let’s cover the basics!
   

  

 💡 Psychometric tests via Alva Labs - We use science-based methodology.
   

  

 🤝 First interview - Time to know each other a bit better!
   

  

 💼 Case interview - Do your magic and show us your skills!
   

  

 ✔️ Reference- & background check - Final step before we’ll become colleagues.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* You have been responsible for large accounts, and have experience from complex negotiation with proven track record
* If you have led a team that will be considered a plus
* Advanced knowledge within Office (excel, powerpoint)
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* Prior experience from eCommerce and/or tech is considered a plus


 Studies have shown that women and some minorities are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every qualification. If you are interested in this role and you have most of the skills we’re looking for, we encourage you to apply anyway!
   

  

**Additional Information**
**What’s in it for you?**
* Wellness allowance topped with the opportunity to participate in many work/life balance initiatives at foodora.
* Employee discount at foodora (woho!) and awesome friday breakfasts!
* Occupational pension, incl. premium exemption insurance, accident insurance and life insurance.
* foodora Learning - Monthly learning sessions about different topics, such as the q-commerce industry, negotiation techniques and project management combined with a structured onboarding and insipring courses within Sana Labs.
* Great deals at Benify (for e.g. gym membership, e-bikes hotels, audiobooks, streaming services, clothes, kitchen supplies… and so much more!
* Awesome AW’s and (pink) parties!

title: Objektspecialist till socialförvaltningen i Huddinge
description:
Huddinge Kommun arbetar sedan ett par år efter en ny styr- och samverkansmodell med syfte att genom gemensamma arbetssätt skapa bättre förutsättningar för verksamhetsutveckling med stöd av digitalisering.
   

  

 Socialförvaltningen söker nu en objektspecialist som vill vara med och driva den digitala utvecklingen framåt tillsammans med engagerade kollegor. Du kommer att tillhöra team systemstöd inom stöd- och utvecklingsenheten. Enheten är ett stöd till hela Socialförvaltningen när det gäller kanslifunktioner, systemförvaltning, verksamhetsuppföljning, kvalitetsarbete och strategiska utvecklingsfrågor. Enheten har en samlad erfarenhet från många olika områden vilket ger goda förutsättningar att genomföra och utveckla det gemensamma uppdraget.
   

  

**Beskrivning av arbetsuppgifter**
 I uppdraget som objektspecialist ingår förvaltning, utveckling och uppföljning av verksamhetssystem samt omvärldsbevakning. Tillsammans med objektledare, övriga objektspecialister och verksamheter har du ansvar för utveckling och förvaltning av socialtjänstens verksamhetsnära IT-stöd. I uppdraget ingår att anpassa systemen efter krav och behov så att de stödjer verksamhetens arbetssätt och processer. Du hanterar ändringsbegäran till/från leverantörer och genomför tester. Du informerar verksamheten om aktuella aktiviteter, system- och driftstatus, dokumenterar och följer upp. Du tillhandahåller målgruppsanpassat användarstöd och utbildning vid behov. I uppdraget ingår att arbeta med införandeprojekt, pilotprojekt och kravinsamling inför upphandlingar. Intern och extern omvärldsbevakning samt samverkan inom förvaltningen och med andra förvaltningar är en förutsättning och framgångsfaktor för att uppnå hög verksamhetsnytta.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig som har god erfarenhet av digitala verksamhetssystem från socialtjänstens verksamhetsområde och har arbetat inom äldreomsorg, funktionsstöd eller individ- och familjeomsorg. Du ska ha en relevant högskoleutbildning eller erfarenheter som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdiga.
   

  

 Har du erfarenhet av att stödja kollegor kring användning av verksamhetssystem och/eller deltagit i något utvecklingsarbete är detta meriterande. Tidigare erfarenhet av att projektleda eller koordinera mindre och medelstora utvecklingsarbeten är önskvärd.
   

  

 Som person är du lösningsfokuserad, strukturerad och kommunikativ. Du arbetar självständigt, är nyfiken och prestigelös. Du har lätt att se helheten och har god samarbetsförmåga. Du är bekväm med att arbeta utifrån olika situationer och förutsättningar, med medarbetare på olika nivåer och roller inom organisationen. Du är van att planera, organisera och prioritera ditt arbete utifrån olika situationer och förutsättningar.
   

  

**Förmåner:**
 Arbeta i Huddinge kommun
   

  

**Upplysningar:**
 Vid frågor om tjänsten kontakta enhetschef : Karin Lindbom, karin.lindbom@huddinge.se, 08 - 53537803 eller 0701984170
   

  

**Om arbetsplatsen** 
 Huddinge är en växande Stockholmskommun med närhet till både stad och natur. Som medarbetare hos oss är du en viktig samhällsbyggare. Tillsammans skapar vi ett hållbart samhälle för alla som bor, besöker och arbetar i Huddinge.
 **Facklig kontaktperson**
 För facklig kontaktperson för tjänsten se Facklig kontaktinformation
   

  

**Anställningens omfattning**
 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning
   

  

 Omfattning: Heltid
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Ansök senast: 2025-08-04
   

  

 Referensnummer: C263543
   

  

**Anställning**
 Antal annonserade arbetstillfällen: 1
   

  

*Vi undanber oss alla erbjudanden om annonsering och rekryteringshjälp i samband med denna annons.*

title: Consulting Sales Director - Public Cloud
job_function: Sales, Business Development, and Information Technology
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, IT System Installation and Disposal, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Consulting Sales Director – Public Cloud** 




  





**Location:** 
**Stockholm, Sweden** 




  





**Global Leading Technology Firm** 




  





 Join a globally recognized IT services leader, renowned for strategic partnerships with thousands of enterprise clients worldwide. As part of a significant investment into its Nordic consulting division, the company is launching a high-growth practice—and this is your opportunity to build the public cloud consulting capability from the ground up.
 



  





 As
 **Consulting Sales Director** 
 , you’ll be a key member of the Nordic leadership team, responsible for driving business development: expanding existing enterprise accounts, winning new logos, crafting go-to-market strategies, and commercializing relationships with C-level stakeholders across some of Sweden’s most recognized enterprises.
 



  





 You’ll operate with a high degree of autonomy—empowered to build a best-in-class capability in a fast-paced, high-investment environment, backed by a globally respected technology brand with substantial financial support.
 



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




  




* Proven commercial background, with a track record of achieving and exceeding revenue targets within consulting or professional services.
* Experience in sales and/or sales leadership roles (e.g., Sales Director, Sales Executive, Business Development Director, consulting P&L responsibility).
* Subject matter expertise in public cloud technologies, solutions, and services (e.g., cloud implementation, migration, modernization, mainframe exit).
* Demonstrated success managing key customer stakeholders at C-level within enterprise-scale organizations.
* Established relationships and successful partnerships with one or more major public cloud hyperscalers (Microsoft Azure, AWS, Google Cloud).
* Strong local enterprise network, either within a specific industry or cross-industry.
* Fluency in a Nordic language (Swedish, Danish, or Norwegian).



  





  





**Next Steps** 




 If your application is successful, we’ll contact you within 48 hours. If you haven’t heard from us in that time, please assume your application was not successful on this occasion.

title: Analysts to Markets Trading
description:
**Job ID: 30212**
**Analyst to Securities Finance & Structured Products Sales, Markets Trading**
 Would you like to join the largest bank in the Nordics? Securities Finance & Structured Products Sales in Nordea Markets is offering a unique opportunity for a talented and ambitious Analyst to be part of the fast-paced trading floor at the leading Nordic investment bank. The job is based in Stockholm, starting as soon as possible, and is designed to kick-start your career within the Markets area.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 The Securities Finance & Structured Products Sales team is responsible for originating, structuring and executing market leading securities finance deals and structured products to a broad range of professional clients such as investment companies, hedge funds and family offices across the Nordics and beyond.
   

  

 In the role you will become an integral part of the team, gaining unparalleled exposure to Nordea’s trading floor through hands-on experience with complex financing structures, securities lending and various equity and credit derivative products. You will learn from and assist experienced colleagues, working closely with our clients to provide first-class capital market products. We offer an ambitious and innovative environment characterized by teamwork and trust, where your ideas and contribution will be valued from day one.
   

  

 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

**What you’ll be doing:**
 Main responsibilities in this role are to assist senior colleagues in day-to-day operations, support client relationships, help prepare client presentations, analyse market opportunities and help structure tailored financing solutions for professional clients across the Nordics. Over time, you will expand your knowledge of our structured, equity and credit derivative product offerings. You will proactively promote our products, identify new market opportunities and build a solid network to increase confidence and visibility in our offerings. Additionally, you will manage information flow and collaborate with stakeholders on projects and client engagements to build trust and confidence in our team’s capabilities.
   

  

* Support senior colleagues in day-to-day operational matters related to clients
* Analyse market opportunities, help structure deals and build client pitches
* Develop expertise in securities finance, equity/credit derivatives, and structured products
* Drive internal and external promotion of our products
* Collaborate and build relationships with stakeholders


**Who You Are**
 We are looking for a curious and highly motivated problem solver with a genuine interest in financial markets and products with a high analytical capacity. We expect our new colleague to be self-driven and have an eagerness to learn.
   

  

**In addition, the successful candidate should fulfil the following criteria:**
* Graduating in 2025 or recently graduated with maximum two years’ work experience post-graduation from university
* Master’s degree within relevant field such as finance, economics or other technical degree with excellent academic credentials from a top-tier university
* Strong proficiency in Excel and other Microsoft Office applications
* Fluent in Swedish and English


**What We Offer**
**People** 
 come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
   

  

**A culture** 
 that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
   

  

**Diversity and inclusion** 
 are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next steps**
 To apply, please submit your application including CV, cover letter and university transcripts as soon as possible. We will interview on a continuous basis and encourage early application, but apply no later than 31/08/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Sina Kazemi (sina.kazemi@nordea.com).
   

  

 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
   

  

**We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good**
**We build relationships.** 
 We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
   

  

**We learn and develop.** 
 We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.
   

  

**We lead change.** 
 We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
   

  

**We are Nordea.** 
 We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.
   

  

 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

title: Manager - Client Services - MFG - Sweden
description:
**Job Description**
**Role Information**
**Role** 
 Engagement Manager
   

  

**Role Designation** 
 Manager – Client Services
   

  

 Senior Manager – Client Services (Higher Proficiency)
   

  

**Career Stream** 
 Global Markets
   

  

**Career Sub Stream** 
 Client Services
   

  

**Reports to** 
 Group Manager - Client Services
 **Billable Role (Y/N)** 
 N
   

  

**Supervises** 
 Associate Business Development Manager/ Associate Manager -- Client Services/ Associate Sales Manager
 **Billable Utilization** 
 NA
   

  

**Financial Size** 
**(Revenue/ Budget/Span)** 
 Average $ 27m p.a. across small, medium and large accounts.
 **Incumbency** 
**(Single/ Multiple)** 
 Multiple
   

  

**Team Size & Dispersion** 
**(Direct & Indirect reports, Single/ Multiple locations)** 
 No. of Direct reports : 1 BM, 1 ADS
 **Location** 
**(Onsite/ Offshore)** 
**Onsite and Offshore**
**Operating Network (Internal)** 
**Group Manager - Client Services, Associate Manager - Client Services/ Business Development Associate , All HBUs, IBU delivery, Finance, Legal, HR, CCD, IS, UPAMs, GEMs, DHs, IBU Heads, and NBD team.**
**Operating Network (External)** 
**Clients (CXOs, Business Leadership, IT Leadership and below, Procurement office, Client Audit & compliance), Alliance partners, and other contractors (direct competitors, other companies managing PMO, independent contractors etc.)**
 1
   

  

 Manager – Client Services
   

  

 Senior Manager – Client Services (Higher Proficiency)
   

  

 Provide client introductions, customer context to internal teams. Navigate account to identify varied kinds of deals; form and lead pursuit teams, recommend & defend the win price, understand client drivers and competitor moves, interface with client on expectations, develop account plan, review and follow it. Drive MSA / SOWs / payments (AR), resolve delivery escalations and complaints, mentor IBU account team with an objective of demonstrating business value to the client. Maintaining the Infosys price premium, enhancing client satisfaction and growing the account as per the account plan WITHIN the assigned account.
   

  

**Educational Qualification\* and Experience Requirements**
 30
   

  

 Manager – Client Services
   

  

 Senior Manager – Client Services (Higher Proficiency)
 **Engineering Graduate** 
**CA / Tier MBA\*** 
**Non Engineering Graduate** 
**PhD**
**Minimum No. of Years** 
 11
 **Career Stream** 
 11 NA
   

  

* Categorized based on Infosys recognized list of colleges and courses


**For Higher Proficiency** 
 30
   

  

**Career Stream** 
**Engineering Graduate** 
**CA / Tier MBA\*** 
**Non Engineering Graduate** 
**PhD**
**Minimum No. of Years** 
 14 Global Markets 14 NA
   

  

 3
   

  

 Global Markets
   

  

 Experience in Business/ IT Consulting, preferably with the big 4, and experience in the local market.
   

  

**Areas of Responsibility**
* Market Development


 The Manager – Client Services persuades clients to provide industry-wide references
 **in order to** 
 support revenue growth outside the account and increase ROI on events.
   

  

* Customer Prospecting


 The Manager – Client Services provides client introductions, customer context etc. S/He supports the HBU G/EM's efforts in his / her account in order to open diverse service-lines (HBUs) in his/her account.
   

  

* Opportunity Identification and Qualification


 The Manager – Client Services will navigate the account to identify varied kinds of deals in the account
 **in order to** 
 increase Infosys' revenue and HBU mix and improve market share.
   

  

* Proposal Development


 The Manager – Client Services will form pursuit team across Bus / external partners if needed. S/He positions client-facing team with client, explain client context, coach the pursuit team, suggest win price and drive this among various BUs based on competitive intelligence, future potential, positioning with client. S/He drives consensus between BU’s on pricing (including revenue transfer if required). S/He recommends and defends win-price at the appropriate levels (considering the size of the deal) of management/finance and procure all approvals. S/He is to clarify client expectations (where possible, coach the client on what s/he can expect based on knowledge of the account and industry), and collect ground level intelligence on client drivers and competitor moves. S/He sets expectations and ratifies the solution with the client
 **in order to** 
 demonstrate business value to the client and maintain Infosys' price premium.
   

  

* Proposal Negotiation and Closure


 The Manager – Client Services sets up and facilitates proposal-coaching sessions between client and pursuit team's technical / domain experts. S/He drives client consensus or at least neutralizes opponents, articulates business value and drives pricing
 **in order to** 
 articulate business value and win the deal at the right premium.
   

  

* Contracting and MSA


 The Manager – Client Services facilitates the discussion for the Commercial Manager, and acts as the point-of-escalation if needed,
 **in order to** 
 ensure quick closure of the contract with acceptable level of risk to Infosys.
   

  

* Account Planning and Review


 The Manager – Client Services develops the Account Plan in conjunction with the other stakeholders (Service line/HBU mix, revenues, profitability. S/He will develop relationship map, and market share analysis. S/He communicates and executes as per the A/c plan; and conducts periodic review of the plan with higher Management in Infosys
 **in order to** 
 grow in the Account as per plan.
   

  

* Account Mining


 The Manager – Client Services identifies the right contacts within the client organization, secures meetings with the clients appropriately; sets appropriate agenda (client context, pain points, industry / competitive context, Infosys value proposition). S/He anchors meetings and closes any opportunities generated. S/He ensures active participation from HBUs / partners concerned, provides account context (including topics to avoid), and allocates roles and responsibilities for ongoing client interactions. S/He reviews meeting material
 **in order to** 
 grow the account by positioning Infosys strategically and as an existing trusted partner.
   

  

* Account Operations


 The Manager – Client Services signs off on SOWs / Contracts and follows up with the client to sign off on the SOWS. S/He acts as the next level of escalation beyond the Commercial Manager for invoice disputes, payment release etc. and follows up with the client to release undisputed payments (AR). S/He Identifies the right list of clients for CSAT and follows up with the client for CSAT and ELF wherever necessary
 **in order to** 
 minimize revenue leakage for services delivered and enhance client satisfaction.
   

  

* Relationship Management


 The Manager – Client Services handles customer complaints about project executions across IBU delivery and HBUs, as well as negotiates on MSAs and SOWs (which the Commercial Manager leads). S/He identifies and recommends the right Infosys executives (starting with Segment Heads) with whom the client can connect; sets up meetings and sets the right expectations. S/He recommends public engagements / conferences / Infosys events that the client and Infosys can jointly benefit from; gets the clients to participate in events and conferences of mutual benefit; and sets up periodic reviews with important customer stakeholders as per the pre-agreed format. S/He undertakes expectation setting with individual clients who can be influenced before the Account relationship review document is presented formally, publishes action items and tracks them to closure. S/He collaborates with Delivery management (HBU & IBU delivery), HBU GEMs, Finance/Legal and IBU Leadership to resolve escalations, identifies and sells to Infosys executives the specific client that they are required to connect with. S/He prepares executive briefing documents, coaches on high level messages that resonate with account context. S/He identifies the right speakers / hosts including self if applicable (next proficiency) at the conferences with whom the client can connect / address the audience. S/He incorporates internal feedback on the relationship review document to be presented, allocates roles to Infosys participants in the review and tracks action items to closure
 **in order to** 
 position Infosys as a trusted, easy partner to do business with, for which the client can increase its spend and be prepared to pay an acceptable price premium.
   

  

* Merger and Acquisition


 The Manager – Client Services reviews ADS' account specific competitor and provides opportunity analyses to Commercial Manager
 **in order to** 
 help validate the business case.
   

  

**Knowledge, Skills Required For The Role**
***Knowledge:***
 Knowledge of outsourcing business, cost & revenue drivers for an IT organization, Business case creation, Financial ratios and analyses (IRR, NPV, ROCE etc.), Statistical analyses (regression, correlation, mean, median, mode, frequency distributions), and knowledge of legal & contracting issues.
   

  

***Skills:***
 Effective and structured communication skills (consultative skills combined with business case creation knowledge), conflict resolution / consensus building skills within Infosys as well as with partners / clients. Problem solving skills, negotiation skills, and commercial acumen. Identification of the political landscape, leadership skills, presentation skills and relationship-building skills (a good sense of humor is an advantage).
   

  

**Performance Measures**
* Market Development


 No. of references provided.
   

  

* Customer Prospecting


 Number of HBU NAOs.
   

  

* Opportunity Identification and Qualification


 Number of requests for proposals for deals > USD 5M - could either be sole sourced or otherwise.
   

  

* Proposal Development


 Average PAT across the proposals submitted.
   

  

* Proposal Negotiation and Closure


 Dollar proposals won; Number (and $) of proposals won / Number (and $) of total proposals submitted. Negotiation effectiveness = Final Price/Going-in price.
   

  

* Contracting and MSA


 Contract / SOW risk rating below XX (as per the grading exercise being carried out in CMS).
   

  

* Account Planning and Review
