title: Senior Client Executive - Enterprise
description:
**Vill du vara med och driva nykundsförsäljningen i ett av Nordens mest snabbväxande fintech-bolag? Vi söker en Senior Client Executive – Enterprise till Walley!** 




  





 Som Senior Client Executive – Enterprise på Walley blir du en nyckelperson i vår fortsatta tillväxtresa i Norden. Du får en central roll i vårt nordiska New Sales-team, där du med insiktsdriven försäljning och stark affärsförståelse hjälper våra kunder att nå sin fulla potential. Du blir en del av en inkluderande och ambitiös kultur där öppenhet, samarbete och högt engagemang står i centrum. Vi arbetar med korta beslutsvägar och stort förtroende för individen – här får du frihet att påverka och möjlighet att utvecklas i takt med verksamheten.
 



  





 I rollen som Senior Client Executive - Enterprise är din primära uppgift att skapa tillväxt genom att vinna nya affärer med några av Nordens ledande e-handels- och retailers. Med en rådgivande säljstil och djup marknadsförståelse guidar du kunderna till lösningar som maximerar deras affär – från ökad konvertering och lönsamhet till en mer personlig och sömlös betalupplevelse. Rollen rapporterar till Head of New Sales och ingår i affärsområdet New Sales.
 



  





**I rollen kommer du att:** 



* Utbilda och utmana kunder genom att dela relevanta marknadsinsikter och analysera deras kundresa och nuvarande betallösning
* Driva förändring genom att visa hur rätt betalningslösning kan stärka kundens affär
* Äga hela säljprocessen – från prospektering och initial kontakt till förhandling och avtal – med ett strategiskt och rådgivande förhållningssätt
* Anpassa budskap och lösningsförslag utifrån kundens affär, behov och aktuella branschtrender
* Bygga långsiktigt förtroende genom att skapa starka relationer och positionera Walley som en strategisk partner, med fokus på enterprise-segmentet
* Samarbeta nära interna team, särskilt inom produktutveckling och integration, för att säkerställa en smidig onboarding och hög kundnytta
* Vara en aktiv branschprofil – delta i event, konferenser och nätverksträffar för att bygga relationer och identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter



  





**Vem är du?** 




 För att lyckas i rollen är du nyfiken, självgående och har en stark vilja att skapa resultat. Du tar aktivt ansvar för din egen utveckling och söker kontinuerligt ny kunskap – genom att reflektera över erfarenheter, lära av kollegor och omgivning samt hålla dig uppdaterad på marknad och trender. Du har ett tydligt fokus på nykundsförsäljning och ett starkt affärsdriv. Med trygghet och tydlighet bygger du snabbt förtroende hos beslutsfattare – även i komplexa affärsdialoger. Du är engagerad, energisk och lösningsorienterad, tar initiativ och kommunicerar klart med förmåga att anpassa dig efter mottagaren. Du är en viktig drivkraft i det interna samarbetet och bidrar till framdrift i försäljningsprocesserna med målsättningen att överträffa förväntningar och bidra till Walleys fortsatta tillväxt.
 



  





**Vi önskar att du har följande kvalifikationer:** 



* Minst två års erfarenhet inom payments och god förståelse för ekosystemet kring digitala betalningar
* Erfarenhet från fintech, e-handel eller SaaS – gärna i roller med fokus på lösningsförsäljning och längre säljcykler
* Dokumenterat starka försäljningsresultat i komplexa affärer
* Van att kommunicera och förhandla med beslutsfattare på flera nivåer
* Flytande svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift



  





**Kontor och resande** 




 Rollen är placerad på Walleys kontor på Linnégatan i Stockholm. Resor till övriga nordiska kontor kan förekomma
 



  





**Ansökan och kontakt** 




 I det här uppdraget samarbetar Walley med The Assessment Company. Har du frågor om tjänsten eller processen är du välkommen att kontakta Elin Midtskogen på 070 577 5243 eller elin.midtskogen@theac.se
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande.
 



  





  





**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Client Executive - Affinity
description:
**Description**
 Älskar du att jobba proaktivt med kunder, bygga relationer samt skapa engagemang? Har du ett starkt driv, arbetar värdeskapande och lösningsorienterat och tar ansvar för att i en nära och förtroendegivarende dialog guida våra kunder i försäkringsfrågor? Då har vi ett spännande jobb för dig.
   

  

 Om du söker tjänsten i vårt fantastiska företag kommer du att få arbeta med duktiga kollegor och i en bra arbetsmiljö.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Rollen**
 WTW Affinity är en ledande leverantör av skräddarsydda och kompletta försäkringslösningar för företag och organisationer som har behov av och/ eller vill erbjuda försäkringar som tillägg till sina huvudsakliga produkter eller tjänster. Vår framgång inom affinity bygger på ett engagerat samarbete med våra kunder. Med djup förståelse och stort intresse för våra kunders utmaningar och möjligheter är vi en fullserviceleverantör som skräddarsyr försäkringsprogram utifrån kundens behov.
   

  

 På daglig basis tar du ansvar för att självständigt förvalta, utveckla och tillgodose våra kunders behov i deras försäkringsarrangemang.
   

  

 I rollen vill du göra detta i en framgångsrik organisation där dina åsikter, idéer och prestationer är avgörande för att förverkliga vår tillväxtambition.
   

  

 Tillsammans med oss vill du växa och utvecklas i din yrkesroll.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Du är trygg i din yrkesroll, stabil som person, lösningsorienterad och engagerad. Du trivs med att ansvara för hela kundåtagandet och har givetvis lätt för att samarbeta och är en god lyssnare. Du har en stark vilja att hjälpa kunderna, guida dem igenom sina olika beslutsprocesser och även när så behövs utmana deras status quo. Din analytiska förmåga bidrar till att förstå kundens verksamhet och därmed kunna bidra med värdeskapande resultat med kundnytta i fokus.
   

  

 Du förstår att goda resultat byggs genom lagarbete och det är därmed naturligt för dig med ett nära samarbete med flera olika och viktiga intressenter, där ditt driv är en förutsättning för att teamet skall vinna.
   

  

* Du är van vid ett självständigt ansvar.
* Du motiveras av att arbeta med en komplex tjänst, där det ställs höga krav på dig, ett starkt resultatfokus och drivs av att uppnå uppsatta mål.
* Du arbetar med kontinuerlig research inom kundsegmentet, följer trender, möjligheter och utmaningar inom relevanta områden, och vet hur kundens vardag, miljö och konkurrenter ser ut.


**Du har**
* Mångårig dokumenterad erfarenhet från liknande roller inom försäkring
* Vana att arbeta och mätas mot uppsatta mål, såsom antal aktiviteter, lönsamhetskrav samt budget
* Erfarenhet av förhandlingssituationer och kan ta beslut som gör skillnad för kunden
* Analytisk förmåga och en stark affärsmässighet
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


**Vi erbjuder**
 Vi erbjuder en centralt placerad arbetsplats med möjlighet till hybridarbete, ett konkurrenskraftigt ersättnings paket och pensionsplan.
   

  

 Att jobba hos oss är att ansluta sig till ett team med motiverade, passionerade och kompetenta kollegor. Du kan se fram emot att dagarna präglas av att kontinuerligt tillskansa dig ny kunskap och erfarenheter samtidigt som du delar med dig av din egen insikt och erfarenhet.
   

  

 Hos WTW har vi en positiv anda och en familjär ton. Företaget drivs utifrån ett långsiktigt perspektiv och andas entreprenörskap. Verksamheten präglas av värdeord som bland annat innefattar personlig utveckling, respekt, teamwork och integritet.
   

  

**Om WTW**
 WTW (NASDAQ: WLTW) är ett ledande globalt försäkringsförmedlings-, och konsultbolag. Med rötter tillbaka till 1828 har WTW 47 000 anställda i mer än 140 länder och marknader.
   

  

 Vi är ett globalt företag som genom lokal närvaro och expertis kan erbjuda skräddarsydda lösningar anpassade till kundens risker och behov, lokala trender, marknader och lagstiftning. Genom kompetens, professionalism, engagemang och kundfokus hjälper vi kunder runt om i världen att vända risk till tillväxtmöjligheter.
   

  

 I Sverige är vi idag en av landets ledande rådgivare inom risk- och försäkringsförmedling inom skadeförsäkringsområdet, pensions- och ersättningslösningar och aktuariella tjänster (liv och sak). Vi är cirka 200 medarbetare i Stockholm (HK), Göteborg och Malmö.
   

  

**A career that moves you**
**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 #Hybrid

title: Systemintegratör
description:
Vill du bidra och verka i en framtidsbransch där megatrender som IoT, hållbarhet, energibesparing och digitalisering är vardag? I rollen som Systemintegratör arbetar du med att utveckla och förbättra den tekniska infrastrukturen och fastighetsdriften i några av samhällets viktigaste byggnader.
   

  

**Hos Oss Får Du**
* Arbeta med innovativ teknik i ett etablerat bolag med stort fokus på hållbarhet
* Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter där du själv äger din egen utveckling i bolaget
* Ett sammansvetsat team med hög teknisk kompetens med ett gemensamt mål att lyckas tillsammans


 Arbetsbeskrivning
   

  

 I denna roll samarbetar du nära våra automationsingenjörer och projektledare inom PLC/DUC-programmering. Du kommer att arbeta med ett brett spektrum av fabrikat och kommunikationsprotokoll och ha en ledande roll i projekt där du ansvarar för tekniken och att kundens förväntningar på kvalitet och ekonomi uppnås. Eftersom arbetet är kundnära, kommer du även att spela en aktiv roll i att bygga och utveckla kundrelationer samt leda projekt mot slutkund.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Akademisk examen inom teknik eller motsvarande kompetens som vi bedömer som likvärdig
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom en liknande roll, gärna inom fastighetsautomation, industriell automation eller relaterat IT-område
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med nätverk och IP-konfigurationer
* B-körkort
* Flytande svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift


 Meriterande
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att serva och underhålla teknisk utrustning, särskilt inom fastighetsautomation och SCADA-system.
* Erfarenhet av att programmera, konfigurera och integrera SCADA- och PLC-system, inklusive datamodellering, signalmappning, felsökning och arbete med vanliga nätverksprotokoll (t.ex. BACnet, Modbus, TCP/IP).
* Tidigare arbetslivserfarenhet inom fastighetsbranschen, industriarbete eller som drifttekniker samt kunskap inom VVS och fastighetsteknik


 Som person är du lösningsorienterad, analytisk och noggrann. Du identifierar snabbt problem och hittar effektiva lösningar samtidigt som du säkerställer hög kvalitet. Du är kommunikativ och samarbetar lätt med både kollegor och kunder. Vidare är du strukturerad, arbetar effektivt mot deadlines och kan hantera dokumentation noggrant och korrekt.
   

  

 Observera att rekryteringsprocessen kan ta lite längre tid än vanligt under sommaren på grund av semestrar. Vi återkommer så snart vi kan!
   

  

 Att vara anställd hos Nordomatic kan innebära att behöva ge samtycke till sekretessbevis och registerkontroll.

title: Global Enterprise Architect till NOTE
description:
**Är du den vi söker?** 




 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens digitala landskap inom en ledande industrikoncern? Som Enterprise Architect på NOTE AB får du en strategiskt viktig roll där du driver arkitekturarbetet framåt och säkerställer att teknik, processer och affärsmål går hand i hand. Här får du möjligheten att påverka på riktigt – från strategi till teknik, från affärsprocesser till systemlandskap.
 



  





**Arbetsbeskrivning** 




 NOTE AB söker en Enterprise Architect som vill ta en central roll i bolagets digitala transformation. Du blir en nyckelspelare i bolagets pågående ERP-implementering och kommer att arbeta nära både ledning och verksamhet för att skapa en modern, skalbar och långsiktigt hållbar arkitektur.
 



  





 I rollen kommer du att:
 



 • Leda utvecklingen av tvärfunktionella arkitekturlösningar
 



 • Agera rådgivare i affärsprocessanalys och digital utveckling
 



 • Säkerställa att tekniska satsningar möter koncernens strategiska mål
 



 • Driva transformationen av bolagets systemlandskap mot framtidens plattformar
 



 • Vara garant för kvalitet, regelefterlevnad och arkitektonisk integritet
 



  





**Din profil** 




 Du har en gedigen bakgrund inom analys, affärsutveckling och systemtransformation – gärna med erfarenhet från tillverkande industri. Med minst 10 års erfarenhet i bagaget och en förståelse för både IT och verksamhet kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att driva bolagets digitala utveckling framåt.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som har examen inom relevant område och gedigen erfarenhet inom analys och affärsarkitektur. Du har tidigare erfarenhet av arbete med etablering av ERP-system i produktionsmiljöer, kunskap inom modellering och en förståelse för regulatoriska krav, inklusive miljöpåverkan. Har du erfarenhet från upphandling och förvärvsprocesser är det mycket positivt. Eftersom NOTE är en internationell koncern med verksamhet i sex länder är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska ett krav.
 



  





 Vi söker en driven person med starka ledaregenskaper som med både logik och empati kan navigera i komplexa arkitekturfrågor. Du är trygg i att prioritera, kompromissa där det krävs och samtidigt driva förändring framåt. Du har ett analytiskt skarpt sinne, ett strategiskt perspektiv och – viktigast av allt – en vilja att forma framtidens affärsarkitektur. Hos oss får du möjlighet att påverka på riktigt, leda i förändring och skapa långsiktigt värde. Vidare är du en naturlig kommunikatör som briljerar både i tal och skrift. Du har också förmågan att engagera i presentationer och skapa delaktighet.
 



  





**Om NOTE AB** 




 NOTE AB är ett svenskt företag som specialiserar sig på att erbjuda kompletta lösningar inom elektroniktillverkning. Företaget tillhandahåller tjänster som sträcker sig från konstruktion och design av elektroniska produkter till produktion och montering av kretskort. NOTE AB riktar sig till företag inom en rad olika branscher, bland annat fordonsindustrin, medicinteknik och telekom. Företaget har en stark fokus på kvalitet och flexibilitet och erbjuder sina kunder både långa och korta produktionsserier. NOTE AB har tillverkningsenheter i flera länder och har etablerat sig som en ledande aktör inom elektronikproduktion i Norden och Europa. Läs mer – www.note-ems.com/
 



  





**Ansök enkelt med ditt CV** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar NOTE med Inhouse IT & Tech. Vi tar inte emot några ansökningar via mejl, utan du söker enkelt tjänsten via hemsidan; www.inhouse.se. Ansök redan idag då urval sker löpande! Därefter kontaktar vi dig för nästa steg. Har du några funderingar så är du välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsult Louise Hagen Furugård, louise.furugard@inhouse.se, 0733118726
 



  





 Hos NOTE får du chansen att arbeta i en expansiv, internationell miljö där du inte bara får vara med och påverka – du får vara med och leda vägen framåt.
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Backend Developer - Customer Solutions
description:
10% of Europe's CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we're making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions, and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Backend Engineer on our Customer Solutions team, you'll build the intelligent systems that power Aira's growth across Europe. This role sits within our Customer Acquisition area, where you'll develop critical backend infrastructure including intelligent recommendation systems, dynamic pricing optimization, and market expansion capabilities. Working in an agile environment with cross-functional teams, you'll help scale our technical platform across diverse European markets while handling complex technical and regulatory requirements.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

  

* Build and maintain our customer solution matching platform—the backend systems that analyze customer inputs and property characteristics to recommend optimal clean energy solutions
* Develop scalable backend services that enable market teams with pricing capabilities and support company bets on new products through intelligent algorithms
* Create flexible, event-driven systems that can easily onboard new clean energy products and adapt to different markets, currencies, and regulatory requirements
* Design and implement APIs and microservices that support rapid geographic expansion while maintaining high performance and reliability


 We're transforming how clean energy solutions are discovered and delivered across Europe through smart backend systems. If you enjoy building scalable systems that directly drive business growth and enable market expansion in a mission-driven environment, this role offers exceptional technical challenges and impact.
   

  

 What you bring to the team
   

  

  

* Strong experience with Java and Spring Boot
* Solid understanding of databases and data modeling (SQL and NoSQL)
* Experience with automated testing (unit tests, integration tests)
* Experience building scalable, distributed systems
* Familiarity with cloud platforms and containerization
* Knowledge of modern development practices (CI/CD, code reviews, agile methodologies)


**Nice to have:**
* Experience with recommendation engines, pricing algorithms, or matching systems
* Database experience (DynamoDB, PostgreSQL)
* Event-driven architectures (Kafka, message queues)
* Cloud DevOps (Docker, Kubernetes, AWS/GCP)
* gRPC and Protobuf
* Infrastructure as Code (Terraform)
* Experience at fast-growing companies expanding into new markets


 Please note:
   

  

 As summer is a time when many of our team members are on vacation, our recruitment process will be slower than usual. We may not be able to review applications and start interviewing until early August, once everyone is back.
   

  

 Thank you for your patience and understanding. We truly appreciate your interest in joining us, and we look forward to connecting with you soon!
   

  

 What is in it for you?
   

  

**Impact & Growth**
* Build systems that directly drive Aira's expansion across Europe and enable market teams
* Work on challenging technical problems including recommendation engines and pricing optimization
* Develop expertise in clean energy markets while contributing to meaningful climate action
* Build scalable infrastructure that supports rapid business growth and product diversification


**Team & Culture**
* Collaborate with talented, mission-driven teams across multiple disciplines and international markets
* Work in an agile, fast-paced environment with modern engineering practices
* Enjoy mentorship opportunities and career development in a growing engineering organization


**Work Environment**
* Hybrid work model with flexibility to balance office and remote work
* Brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm, conveniently located near Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations
* Competitive compensation and benefits package


 At Aira, we champion the next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Team Lead Java Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
****Essential requirements:****
* At least 7 years of experience working in cross-functional agile development teams
* Solid hands-on experience with Java
* Proficiency in Spring Boot
* Experience working with Kafka
* Strong skills in API development and system integration
* Understanding of DevOps practices and experience with related tools
* Experience with testing, including unit testing
* Proficiency with Maven for build and dependency management
* Strong communication skills in both Swedish and English


**Meritorious:**
* Experience with OpenShift or equivalent container orchestration platforms
* Familiarity with Hazelcast or similar in-memory data grids
* Experience with JSP or similar Java-based templating technologies
* Working knowledge of Docker, Jenkins (or equivalent)
* Understanding of Spring Security and JWT (JSON Web Tokens)
* Experience with Feature Toggles
* Knowledge of mainframe integration


**Last day to apply** 
 : 07-07-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Senior Mining Engineer within mine planning
description:
Are you passionate about mine planning and want to be part of our work in one of the world's most high-tech underground iron ore mine? We are seeking a Senior Mining Engineer to join our Mine Planning team in Kiruna, Sweden.


Ort: Kiruna
Anställningsform: Tillsvidare
Ansök senast: 2025-08-15  


**Shaping the future**
----------------------


At LKAB, we are leading the transformation of our industry toward a sustainable future. Just as we aim to reshape the world, we are committed to developing every individual on our team, both personally and professionally. Are you ready to help shape the future of the mining and mineral industry?



**Your role**
-------------


As we mine at greater depths, we face new and complex challenges that require more efficient ways of working. That is why continuous improvement is essential. As a Senior Mining Engineer, you will be a key driver of improvement initiatives — from reconciliation processes to identifying and proposing measures that enhance productivity, efficiency, and cost-effectiveness. You will be part of a diverse and multicultural mine planning department and report directly to our Group Manager.In addition, you will:



* Ensure that mine planning deliverables meet the planning calendar requirements following the company’s interest. This includes the LOMP through to the monthly plan.
* Contribute significantly to the development and updating of the cave management plan
* Implement and maintain mine planning standards, in collaboration with strategic planning group regarding mine design and mine schedule guidelines
* Coaching and technical development of the mine planning-design team.


**What you bring**
------------------


We are looking for a Mining Engineer with a minimum of a B.Sc. and at least five years of relevant experience in mine planning – preferably in a caving environment – and ideally around ten years of overall experience in the mining industry.



You are someone who enjoys thinking ahead, taking initiative, and working in a setting where things can shift quickly. You value teamwork and open communication, and you know that good collaboration across departments and with external stakeholders is key to getting things done well.



In addition, we believe you bring:



* A solid understanding of the full mine planning process, including ground control management, planning software, cut-off grade (COG) calculations, and modifying factors
* A valid driver’s license equivalent to a Swedish B-class license
* Fluency in English, both spoken and written. Swedish is meritorious, regardless of proficiency level


**What we offer**
-----------------


* Relocation support for you and your family.
* Excellent conditions for settling in. We guide you through the official procedures necessary to settle in the country if you come from outside Sweden. We also provide temporary accommodation for a reasonable period and help you find a permanent place to live according to your personal needs.
* LKAB helps you learn Swedish, a tool for a better understanding of Swedish culture.
* The Swedish vacation law entitles all employees to five weeks of vacation per year, and four consecutive weeks during June, July, or August. Your contract may include extra vacation days.
* Reward program.
* Free access to LKAB’s own gym and our partners’ facilities in Norrbotten.
* Wellness allowance and educational support, along with access to an art association, leisure club, mountain cabins, and family activities.
* Enhanced parental pay with up to 90% of your regular salary for up to six months (after one year of employment).
* Support and assistance in cases of illness or questions about work environment, health, wellness, and rehabilitation.
* Compensation for dental care and protective eyewear, including terminal glasses.
* Opportunity to apply for scholarships for both your and your children’s studies
* Access to our pension and insurance program with favourable rates.


**Additional information:**
---------------------------


Please submit your application by August 15th 2025. We review applications on an ongoing basis and may fill the position before the deadline.



This is a full-time job and the job is based in Kiruna. Kiruna is located in Swedish Lapland above the Arctic Circle, offering great opportunities for fantastic outdoor activities both in summer and winter. For more information, please visit the website Kiruna Sweden – Kiruna Tourist Information – Visit Kiruna.



For more information about the position, please contact our hiring manager Theofanis Apeslidis at theofanis.apeslidis@lkab.com.



Union representatives: Unionen, Sakari Alanko, 0980-725 08, Akademikerföreningen, Peter Johansson, 0980-718 79, Ledarna, Ingegerd Kyrö, 0980-710 50.

title: Android Engineer - Kotlin
description:
**Job Description** **WHAT YOU WILL DO:**


As a Software Engineer - Android in the CX & Sales organization you will be in the center of the action where both design and product meets business. You will work closely with designers, product managers, and fellow engineers to develop high-quality Android applications that deliver outstanding user experiences.


You should have a strong technical background, a passion for developing generic and customizable UI components, android mobile application development. Drive to deliver bug-free developer and user experiences as per the business requirement, without compromising on the industry best coding practices.


We are looking for highly skilled and experienced developer for the role of Mid-Level Android Software Engineer to join our mobile development team at H&M. As an Android Developer, you will be be expected to contribute to all stages of app development, from concept to deployment and maintenance.

**You will:**

* Contribute to the design and development of Android app features from concept through implementation.
* Collaborate with product managers, designers, and backend engineers to understand feature requirements and translate them into scalable technical solutions.
* Build and maintain reusable UI components and libraries using Jetpack Compose, ensuring code quality and modularity.
* Write clean, maintainable, and efficient Kotlin code following best practices and architectural guidelines (e.g., MVVM, Clean Architecture).
* Ensure app stability and responsiveness by writing unit and UI tests, debugging, and performance tuning.
* Participate in peer code reviews, contributing to knowledge sharing and quality improvements across the team.
* Troubleshoot and resolve bugs and production issues, collaborating with QA and backend teams to identify root causes.
* Participating in design discussions.
* Stay current with Android development trends and suggest improvements to tools, libraries, and development workflows.
* Take part in Agile ceremonies like sprint planning, retrospectives, and daily stand-ups, and help estimate effort for tasks.

**WHO YOU ARE**

*We are looking for people with..*

* 3+ years of professional experience in Android development.
* Proficiency in Kotlin.
* Solid understanding of Android SDK, Material Design, and Jetpack components.
* Hands-on experience with Jetpack Compose.
* Experience working with RESTful APIs, third-party libraries, and JSON.
* Familiarity with Android architectural patterns (e.g., MVVM, Clean Architecture).
* Experience with version control systems, especially Git.
* Knowledge of dependency injection frameworks (e.g., Hilt, Dagger).
* Understanding of mobile app performance, memory management, and debugging tools.
* Familiarity with testing frameworks (e.g., JUnit, Espresso, Mockito).
* Good communication and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to work in an agile development environment.
* Implemented accessible solutions.

**Good to Have:**

* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines for Android.
* Exposure to mobile analytics tools (e.g., Firebase, Mixpanel).
* Published apps in the Google Play Store.
* Experience working in a cross-platform environment or with teams using iOS.

  

**Additional Information** **WHO WE ARE**  

H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.  

  

We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. Read more about us here

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**  

At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.  

  

All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.

**JOIN US**  

Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.

**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**
company_description: At H&M, we welcome you to be yourself and challenge you to grow and make a difference. Help us reimagine the future of an entire industry, making everyone look, feel & do good.

title: Process Engineer
description:
Do you have an interest in technology and innovation? Do you have a mind set for systematic problem solving? We are now looking for a Process Engineer to join us at HMS Networks.



As a person you are innovative and capable of turning ideas and development opportunities into concrete improvements with good results. High problem-solving skills are important. You are used to manage projects, with good ability to communicate and collaborate with all parts of the organization. You enjoy and are comfortable with moving between the production floor and other parts of the company.



Here with us at HMS, you will have the opportunity to work within an exciting electronics production and world-leading experts.


### **ABOUT THE ROLE**



We’re looking for a Process Engineer to join our Operations team – a key role that bridges the gap between R&D and Production, ensuring smooth, high-quality implementation of new products in manufacturing. You’ll be part of our Process Engineering group, working closely with purchasing, planning, testing, quality, and production development to continuously refine how we build, assemble, and deliver.



As a Process Engineer with orientation NPI Lead, your core mission will be to ensure that new product introductions (NPIs) are seamlessly integrated into our production processes – on time, with quality, and for the long term. You’ll also help us continuously improve and innovate how we work.


**Key responsibilities include:**


* Leading new product introductions (NPI) from prototype to full-scale production
* Optimizing and developing manufacturing processes and workflows
* Creating and maintaining work instructions and assembly documentation
* Handling product and design changes from a production readiness perspective
* Maintaining and developing production systems, equipment and tools
* Training and supporting operators on new processes and tools
* Driving continuous improvements

### **ABOUT YOU**



We’re looking for someone proactive, collaborative, and technically skilled – with a drive to improve and a structured way of working. You enjoy working across functions and take pride in delivering high-quality, long-lasting solutions.


**To succeed in this role, you likely have:**


* A degree in engineering with adequate orientation (e.g. production development, industrial engineering)
* A few years of experience in a similar role within manufacturing or process development
* Knowledge of production economics, lean tools, and improvement methodologies
* Good IT skills and familiarity with production support systems
* Experience with electronics manufacturing and automation (a plus)
* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English

### **ABOUT US**



At HMS, we believe that connecting matters in everything from making machines talk to engaging with our customers. Our state-of-the-art technology provides a fast and easy way to network millions of industrial devices all over the world. From factory automation to connected buildings, remote solutions, and future technologies, we provide innovative solutions that save you time and money creating a more productive and sustainable world. HMS stands for Hardware Meets Software ™.



HMS is a truly international company, and we like to think that we share a common culture. Heart, Mind and Soul is a summary of how we do things (makes for a pretty good abbreviation too).



Welcome to HMS, this is HMS!



### **ABOUT THE EMPLOYMENT AND THE APPLICATION**



As part of this recruitment process, you have the option to submit a short introduction video, where you tell us why you’re interested in this role. At HMS, we truly value our company culture and the amazing people who shape it—so feel free to let your personality shine through! The video should be no longer than 1 minute, and it's completely optional.



Due to the upcoming summer holidays, the position will remain open for applications until August 10th. Please note that no selection or feedback will take place between weeks 28 and 32. We will begin interviews at the end of August and into early September.



If you want to know more about the role or the recruitment process, please contact responsible recruiter.



Welcome with your application!

title: Systemingenjör Automotive
description:
The Opportunity
  
We are looking for a Senior System Engineer with proven experience in BEV development to lead the architecture, validation, and optimization of high-voltage powertrain systems. The ideal candidate has a strong track record working with electric drive units, battery packs, and embedded control systems within the automotive sector.
  
(Actrify is expanding and opportunities exist in both Gothenburg and Stockholm on similar roles. Read below)
  
  

Key Responsibilities
  
Architect and lead system integration for BEV platforms, including energy storage, BMS, power electronics, and electric drive units.
  
Define and manage system-level requirements, ensuring compliance with automotive functional safety (ISO 26262) and quality frameworks (ASPICE).
  
Coordinate controller development for electric drive units and battery systems, overseeing embedded software functionality.
  
Collaborate with cross-functional teams across hardware, software, test, and validation to deliver integrated propulsion systems.
  
Support verification and validation of electric propulsion systems through lab and vehicle testing.
  
Perform safety analyses including FMEA and functional safety assessments.
  
Lead supplier interactions and manage technical deliverables from both internal and external stakeholders.
  
  

Minimum Qualifications
  
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mechatronics, Electrical, Automotive Engineering, or equivalent.
  
5+ years of industry experience in electric propulsion or high-voltage energy storage systems.
  
  

**Demonstrated expertise in areas similar e.g:**  

Development of electric drive controllers (e.g., for front and rear EDUs).
  
Battery Management Systems and high-voltage energy storage.
  
System engineering processes under ISO 26262 and ASPICE.
  
Powertrain software architecture and in-vehicle diagnostics.
  
Experience in project leadership roles with end-to-end ownership of BEV component or system delivery.
  
Proficiency in MATLAB/Simulink, Vector tools, CANalyzer/CANoe, and hardware-in-the-loop (HiL) testing.
  
Strong analytical, communication, and documentation skills.
  
  

Why Join Us?
  
Be part of shaping the next generation of electric vehicles.
  
Work alongside top-tier engineers in a high-impact environment.
  
Challenging projects and support for continuous learning.
  
  

About Actrify
  
Actrify is a leading consultancy specializing in electrification, charging solutions, battery technology, system engineering, and Battery Management Systems (BMS). Our mission is to accelerate electrification, contributing towards a more sustainable and intelligent world alongside our customers.
  
As part of the Vinn Group, we have over 500 specialized consultants across diverse technical domains.
  
  

Our company is expanding in both Gothenburg and Stockholm, and we are looking for experienced team members to join in areas like. Electric propulsion (Inverter, Electric motor drive, Battery Management system) and diagnostics of BMS
  
Software developer
  
Embedded Developer
  
  

System verification Engineer, System Calibration engineer, system design engineer in both HW and SW area of
  
Inverter
  
Electric motor drive
  
Battery
  
Charging
  
  

Welcome to join our Team!
  
Send email with CV to thien.laubeck@actrify.com
  
+46739-888496

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**What we should tell you about the company:**


Filed is building the **first AI tax preparer** trusted by America’s accounting firms. This industry might seem boring—but it’s a $70B backbone of the economy that’s breaking under a talent shortage no one has solved. We’re fixing it—fast.


In just 9 months, we’ve hit **strong product-market fit**, are generating insanely **fast-growing, ridiculously sticky revenue**, and are **backed by top-tier investors**. We’re not a tool—we’re the missing workforce firms have been sounding the alarm for. We’re building the future with expanding our already 30 person team, with those who want to say **“I was there when it all started.”**


https://techcrunch.com/2025/05/21/filed-raises-17m-to-automate-the-drudgery-of-tax-prep/


⸻

**What we should tell you about the role:**


We’re looking for a full-stack engineer who moves fast and thrives in high-velocity environments. You’re the kind of person who sees a broken workflow, understands the root cause quickly, and ships a fix in hours—not weeks. You love turning ambiguity into working software, and you don’t wait around for perfect specs to start building.


You’re a generalist who’s just as comfortable spinning up a backend service as you are crafting a clean, responsive UI. You sweat the details, but never let them block progress. You think in terms of speed, value, and iteration—always asking: how can we get this in front of users faster?


As one of our earliest engineers, you’ll help shape the core product and infrastructure. You’ll work closely with design, ML, and actual tax pros to reinvent how this industry works—by shipping fast, learning fast, and doing what others said couldn’t be done.


Our product and engineering team is based in **Stockholm**. We’re prioritising local candidates, but will **consider candidates from elsewhere in the EU, who can travel to Stockholm.**


⸻

**Here’s why this is a terrible job:**

* This is not a job for someone who likes to move slow.
* We operate week to week with ruthless speed. Sometimes we’re going in the wrong direction, but more times than not we’re going in the right direction.
* If you need a few extra days to perfect your code, chances are there’s already a handful of team members blocked behind you.
* We use tools like Cursor to move fast, test ideas in days, and ship extremely fast.
* You’ll be operating at the intersection of product logic, machine learning, user psychology, and highly regulated workflows.
* There are no clear answers. Just judgment calls, ambiguity, and constant input from every direction.
* You’ll ask yourself, is this really the work? It is. And it’s not for everyone.


⸻

**Here's why it's the best career choice you'll make:**

* We’re building what tax pros call impossible. A product that behaves like a teammate, not just another tool.
* We run reviews every 4 months. We operate with total transparency around pay, performance, and progress.
* You’ll be paid above market. You’ll earn equity that grows fast. And you’ll have full autonomy to make high-impact decisions.
* You’ll ship code because you believe in it, not because it got signed off.
* You’ll talk to customers weekly. You’ll drive outcomes end to end.
* We’ll tell you what needs to be achieved. How you get there is on you.
* We expect you to build a customer Oracle. An internal simulator so dialed in that you can predict exactly what your user needs before you ever talk to them.
* That comes from immersion, curiosity, and care.


⸻

**The teammate we're looking for:**

* Thrives at solving complex, technical product problems
* Moves seamlessly between systems thinking and detailed execution
* Excited by the challenge of serving multiple user groups and workflows
* No lone wolves — we need a collaborative engineer
* Big bonus if you have a track record of owning product outcomes, not just tasks


⸻

**What you’ll be responsible for:**

* Architecting and building complex workflows across the full stack
* Co-owning the entire product experience from backend to frontend
* Driving product direction through technical execution and intuition
* Becoming an Oracle with a best-in-class customer model in your head


⸻

**Your hard skillset:**

* Deep experience across backend and frontend systems
* Fluency in TypeScript, Python, or similar modern stacks
* Comfortable with infra, APIs, databases, and debugging messy edge cases
* Bonus if you’ve used AI tools to accelerate development
* Even bigger bonus if you’ve worked in regulated or high-trust domains


⸻

**Your soft skillset:**

* Comfortable being uncomfortable and making calls with incomplete data
* Empathetic and curious — building for the user, not just for elegance
* Highly collaborative across product, design, and customer support
* Detail-oriented but pragmatic — you know when polish matters and when to move
* You own your work and welcome the accountability that comes with it


⸻

**Growth and Levels:**


We operate on six levels, from Level 1 to Level 6. Each reflects increasing ownership, impact, and scope with meaningful jumps in salary and equity.


We review levels every 4 months. Promotions are based on output and ownership, not tenure.


This isn’t a comfy engineering role. It’s fast, focused, and customer-obsessed.


You will build fast. You will learn fast. You will own what you ship.


⸻

**The process:**

* Quick intro call (30 minutes)
* Code walkthrough and async task (60 minutes)
* Final round with our team (120 minutes)


In just 3.5 hours, you’ll be wanting early access, just like the rest of our team—to dive into the codebase and help build a generational company, even before you start as you'll be able to see the opportunity to transform your career.


Compensation Range: $82.5K - $143K

title: Landing Gear System Engineer (Aerospace Design Engineer)
description:
We are now looking for a Mechanical System Design Engineer (Aerospace Design Engineer) for our client, to join a high-performing team within the Landing Gear and Brake system technology area.


You will be a part of a diverse, collaborative and supportive organisation with an emphasis on professional growth and work-life balance.


You will work on designing functions in aircraft for different customers using mechanics, electronics and software. The work is done both in smaller assignments and in larger projects within the extensive international collaboration with subcontractors and partners.

**Tasks & Responsibilities:**  

  

Develop system and hardware of the Landing Gear and Brake system, which involves design, requirements and documentation.  

Ensure that the Landing Gear and Brake system is well integrated with other sub-systems in the aircraft.  

Participate in feasibility studies for new projects and products.  

Perform system investigations and design.  

Collaborate with several other areas internally at the company e.g. system safety, flight testing and maintenance, etc.  

  

**Requirements:**  

  

* You have experience in designing complex systems combined with the knowledge of mechanical system design engineering, aerospace system engineering, optimal control theory and fluid dynamics.
* You are open to learning, collaboration, and knowledge sharing. It is important that you understand the power of communication and that you enjoy working with others.
* You are a person with drive who is outgoing and good at making contacts.
* You have the ability to handle several tasks at the same time and work independently as well as in groups.
* You are fluent in both spoken and written English.

**Qualifications:**

* Masters or Bachelor degree in Engineering, e.g. aerospace, systems design, technical physics, mechanical engineering, or similar.
* Experience in the current or nearby technology field is a merit and experience of requirement management and verification of requirements is helpful.
* It is an advantage to have some knowledge in thermal physics and physical simulations.

 *The interviews are ongoing, so we encourage you to apply asap.*

title: Senior full-stack engineer
description:
We’re looking for a senior full-stack engineer to join our team at Umain. You’ll work on a mix of greenfield builds, product extensions, and system integrations, often in parallel and always in close collaboration with designers, strategists, and clients.


Our team is based in central Gothenburg, working out of a modern, light-filled office on Kungsgatan. It’s designed for focused work, creative collaboration, and a relaxed daily rhythm.


If you’ve thrived in agency or consultancy environments and enjoy bringing clarity and quality to fast-moving projects, this role is likely a good fit.

**About the role**
==================


At Umain, we help ambitious partners design, build, and scale digital products. We shape ideas early, ship working software quickly, and evolve systems over time. Our teams are cross-functional and client-facing, and engineers are involved from discovery to delivery.


This role is broad by design. One month you might build a custom ecommerce frontend that connects to a backend system via APIs; the next, you could be designing a scalable backend for a logistics platform. You’ll move between different client needs and technical stacks, balancing fast delivery with thoughtful engineering. We value engineers who enjoy this kind of variety and care about both the quality of the work and the way it’s done.

**What you’ll do**
==================

* Build modern frontend experiences using frameworks like Next.js, Svelte, or Flutter for web
* Design and implement backend APIs and integration layers using languages like Go, Kotlin or Typescript. We might also move in to Rust.
* Work with headless CMS and ecommerce platforms including Centra, Shopify, and MedusaJS
* Lead and contribute to short- and medium-term client projects, from concept to launch
* Collaborate with designers and strategists to shape what we build and why
* Support internal knowledge sharing and team practices across projects

**Who you are**
===============

* A full-stack engineer with 5+ years of experience, ideally including agency or consultancy work
* Confident switching between frontend, backend, and dev tooling when needed
* Comfortable scoping work, clarifying ambiguity, and collaborating with non-engineers
* Curious, pragmatic, and able to balance delivery speed with technical quality
* Strong communicator in both written and spoken formats

**What we offer**
=================

* Varied, real-world projects that challenge and grow your skillset
* A team that values curiosity, autonomy, and direct communication
* A personal coach to support your development and wellbeing
* A transparent growth framework and fair, equal compensation
* Colleagues who take the work seriously but not themselves
* A flexible work culture that fits around your life, not the other way around

  

We are hoping to onboard a team of 2+ colleagues in October. We're growing fast and would love for you to shape the future with us.

title: Technical Team Lead - IES (LPD) Nordics
description:

achieving:

This job description does not describe all the duties, tasks and responsibilities which need to be performed in the function. Therefore, the job holder may be asked to undertake other job related instructions, duties, tasks or responsibilities as requested by the FSM or Senior FSM.
